definitions.definition: To hit someone with a car or other vehicle and injure or kill them.
definitions.example: He was run down while crossing the main road.

definitions.definition: To criticize someone or an organisation, often unfairly.
definitions.example: Don't run yourself down so much!

definitions.definition: To find something or someone after searching for a long time.
definitions.example: I finally managed to run down that report. I had filed it incorrectly.

definitions.definition: To lose power slowly. Used for a machine, battery, or other powered device.
definitions.example: If you don't switch off the car lights, you will run the battery down.

definitions.definition: To read quickly a list or other short text.
definitions.example: Running down the list of suggestions, I can see three we can discard immediately.

definitions.definition: To describe in the form of a rundown, a rough outline or summary.
To reduce the size or stock levels of a business, often with a view to closure.
definitions.example: The board of directors have decided to run down the stocks held in storage prior to offering the company for sale.

definitions.definition: To chase till the object pursued is captured or exhausted.
To run against and sink, as a vessel.
To crush; to overthrow; to overbear.
